edge: A movie is a form of visual communication that uses moving pictures and sound to tell stories, convey information, or entertain an audience. In the context provided, 'HERE IS THE DETAILS OF MOVIE'S SUMMARY:' indicates that summary refers to the part that gives a brief idea about the plot, characters, and other important aspects of a movie.

Epic Movie is a parody film that mostly references popular films such as The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, Harry Potter, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Pirates of the Caribbean, and X-Men.
Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are the writers and directors of Epic Movie.
Kal Penn is a cast member in Epic Movie.

In Epic Movie, Peter is a mutant at Mutant Academy and often teased for his chicken-like wings.

During the pre-battle party, Susan gets drunk and vomits everywhere, disgusting their army enough that nobody shows up to help the orphans the next day.
The four siblings engage the White Bitch in battle and all, except for Peter, are killed.
After finding a magic remote, Peter uses its powers to revive his siblings.
Together, they kill the army and defeat the White Bitch, stopping her plan.
Peter declares that the White Bitch will receive a fair and just trial in the new Gnarnia.

Decades later, Borat congratulates the now-elderly rulers on a happy ending, but Jack's wheel accidentally runs over them, killing them.
The film was an economic success for its producers due to its comparatively low budget of $20 million.
Epic Movie has an approval rating of 2% based on 66 reviews and an average rating of 2.8/10.
Audiences polled by CinemaScore gave the film an average grade of 'Câˆ’' on an A+ to F scale.
The film has a score of 17 out of 100 based on 17 critics, indicating 'overwhelming dislike'.
Scott called the film 'irreverent and also appreciative, dragging its satiric prey down to the lowest pop-cultural denominator'.
Coolidge and Fred Willard added some easy, demented class to the film.
LaSalle thought 'only a complete idiot could think Epic Movie is remotely funny or worth making at all'.
Chun described the film as 'nothing more than a disjointed'''

In the Los Angeles Times, Alex Chun called the film 'nothing more than a disjointed series of scenes and references cobbled together as a backdrop for sophomoric humor.' This suggests that the perpetrators or filmmakers were thinking of creating a film with disorganized scenes and jokes that are considered immature by reviewer Alex Chun.

Ronnie Scheib of Variety called the film 'epically unfunny.' This implies that the concept or idea behind creating this movie was not intended to be humorous on a grand scale, according to Ronnie Scheib's review.

node_2: unlikely to join the list of blockbusters it lampoons
edge: Ronnie Scheib of Variety also stated that this movie 'is unlikely to join the list of blockbusters it lampoons.' This suggests that the filmmakers' intention was to spoof or satirize popular blockbuster films, but according to Ronnie Scheib's opinion, it is not expected to be as successful or influential as those movies.

node_2: disjointed series of scenes and references
edge: Alex Chun of the Los Angeles Times described the film as 'nothing more than a disjointed series of scenes and references cobbled together as a backdrop for sophomoric humor.' This indicates that the movie's creators may have intended to include scattered scenes and allusions, possibly as a parody or homage to other films.
The Chicago Reader described Epic Movie as being 'the cinematic equivalent of a tapeworm'.
John Patterson wrote in his review for The Guardian that 'Epic Movie is an epic catastrophe'.
John Patterson also wrote in his review for The Guardian that 'Epic Movie is an artistic failure of epic proportions'.
The film was described as 'An Emetic Piece of Insufferable Crap'
The Times expressed surprise that 'Penn would stoop so low'.
At the 28th Golden Raspberry Awards ceremony, Epic Movie was nominated for 'Worst Remake or Rip-off'.
At the 28th Golden Raspberry Awards ceremony, Carmen Electra was nominated for 'Worst Supporting Actress' for her role in Epic Movie.
